{{COI|date=September 2018}} '''Maple Landmark Woodcraft''' is a [[Wood|wooden]] products [[Manufacturing|manufacturer]] located in [[Middlebury, Vermont|Middlebury]], [[Vermont]]. Founded in 1979 by Michael Rainville, the business is known for crafting [[Made in USA|American-made]] wooden toys, games, and gifts. Notable product lines include the NameTrains [[Wooden toy train|Wooden Railway System]], Montgomery Schoolhouse, and Schoolhouse Naturals.{{Infobox company | name = Maple Landmark Woodcraft | logo = [[File:Maple Landmark Logo 2014.png|frameless|center]] | type = [[Privately held company]] | industry = [[Manufacturing]], [[Retailing|retail]] | founder = Mike Rainville | area_served =Worldwide (primarily [[United States]]) | key_people = Mike Rainville ([[CEO]]) | products = Wooden toys | brands = {{hlist|NameTrains Wooden Railway System|Montgomery Schoolhouse|Schoolhouse Naturals}} | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = 40+ | parent = | subsid = | footnotes = | foundation = 1979 | location = [[Middlebury, Vermont]] | homepage = [http://www.maplelandmark.com/ Maple Landmark Woodcraft] }}
==History==
=== 1970s === Mike Rainville first came to [[woodworking]] as a [[hobby]] when he was 11. At that time, his mother, Pat, told him that, “he needed to find something to do.” Rainville’s grandparents had a history of working with their hands, specifically woodworking and farming, so there were always materials around to utilize. Rainville made his first items, spools and [[bobbin]] holders, in his parents’ [[basement]] in [[Lincoln, Vermont|Lincoln]], [[Vermont]], using some spare wood, a [[coping saw]], and a [[sanding block]]. As time progressed, he started making [[cribbage]] boards which are still being made today. Local [[craft fairs]] provided him with income to purchase new equipment and materials. By 1979, Rainville had established his first [[wholesale]] relationship.
=== 1980s === Rainville continued making product as he worked his way through [[Clarkson University]], frequently returning to Lincoln on weekends. After graduating in 1984, he set about constructing a new woodshop of sufficient size for his now-full-time business. The name “Maple Landmark Woodcraft” was also adopted. This name was an extension of Maple Landmark Homestead, the family [[maple sugaring]] business and [[Dairy farming|dairy farm]].
In 1987, Maple Landmark acquired Troll’s Toy Workshop of [[Barnet, Vermont]]. This addition brought in many [[alphabet]]-themed products, including letter cars, blocks, and signage letters. The company quickly grew to warrant more full-time employees.
=== 1990s === [[File:NameTrains logo.png|thumb|right|NameTrains logo]] The product line evolved over the following decade, adding items such as [[trivet]]s, [[Christmas ornament|ornaments]], and the first NameTrains, a derivative line of the Troll’s Toy Workshop line alphabet letter car line. Originally finished with a clear coat, the NameTrains rapidly increased in popularity. As more retailers expressed interest in having colored letters, a non-toxic color dye [[stain]] was developed and the first colored NameTrains appeared on the market in 1994.
Production of these new products made space tight in the Lincoln facility by late 1994. With no room to expand, the decision was made to build a new shop in [[Middlebury, Vermont]] that would have easier access to raw materials and a retail space for visitors to shop for products year-round. Maple Landmark moved into the new shop on Exchange Street in Middlebury in 1996. The original woodshop still exists in Lincoln, though mostly used for storage, and is usually referred to as “the Old Shop.”
With the need to keep up with product demand, both in quantity and quality, investments were made in lasers and additional [[Numerical control|CNC]] [[Router (woodworking)|routers]]. These machines allowed for more production in less labor-intensive manners. The lasers also gave Maple Landmark the ability to add graphic designs to products, creating the option to do custom work alongside regular production work.
More products and more machines required the enlargement of the Middlebury factory to {{convert|15000|sqft|m2}} in 1999.
=== 2000s === [[File:Montgomery Schoolhouse logo.png|thumb|Montgomery Schoolhouse logo]] In 2001, Maple Landmark purchased Montgomery Schoolhouse of [[Montgomery, Vermont]], another long-established Vermont-based wooden toy producer. The acquisition was inspired by Rainville’s desire to not see the Montgomery Schoolhouse name, products, and history lost and forgotten. All operations were consolidated in Middlebury and, moving forward, products were redesigned to be more efficiently produced. Through the changes, the names and integrity of the products lines were maintained.
The [[Early 2000s recession|economic downturn in the early-2000s]] impacted business as toys, games, and gifts were often bought with discretionary income. Low growth continued until the summer of 2007 when [[2007 Chinese export recalls|products from other countries and manufacturers were being recalled]] for child health and safety reasons. These recalls boosted Maple Landmark's business in late 2007 and 2008<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/23/us/23toys.html|title=You Think Santa Is Busy? Talk to a Wood Toy Maker|last=Zezima|first=Katie|date=2007-12-23|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-06-16|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/money/industries/manufacturing/2007-10-13-americantoys_N.htm|title=American-made toys gain in popularity for now - USATODAY.com|website=usatoday30.usatoday.com|access-date=2017-06-16}}</ref> with consumers looking for products and companies that they could trust.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/08/15/business/15toys.html|title=U.S.-Made Toys Benefit From China’s Troubles|last=Martin|first=Andrew|date=2007-08-15|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-06-16|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> Simultaneously, Maple Landmark Woodcraft developed the Schoolhouse Naturals line of products, featuring simple [[Engraving|engraved]] wooden toys without any finishes. This product line was popular among consumers that were particularly concerned about chemicals.
In January 2009, Maple Landmark created a wooden [[souvenir]] [[train]] for the United States presidential [[First inauguration of Barack Obama|inauguration]] following the [[United States presidential election, 2008|election of Barack Obama in 2008]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.wcax.com/story/20652922/a-toy-picked-for-inauguration|title=Vt. toy picked for inauguration|last=News|first=WCAX|access-date=2017-06-16|language=en}}</ref>
=== 2010s === In an effort to stay flexible and innovative, Maple Landmark purchased several printers that allow for full color printing on wood. These additions allowed for more colorful and intricate designs, both in standard and custom product.
In January 2013, Maple Landmark created a wooden souvenir [[limousine]] for the United States presidential [[Second inauguration of Barack Obama|inauguration]] following the [[United States presidential election, 2012|reelection of Barack Obama in 2012]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.addisonindependent.com/201301maple-landmark-produces-presidential-toy-limousine-inauguration-0|title=Maple Landmark produces toy limousine for Obama inauguration {{!}} Addison County Independent|website=www.addisonindependent.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-16}}</ref>
In 2014, Adam Rainville, Mike's older son, returned to the business after studying at Clarkson University.
In 2016, a {{Convert|11000|sqft|m2}} addition was completed on the Middlebury factory, bringing the total to {{Convert|28,000|sqft|m2}}.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://addisoncountyedc.org/about/news/maple-landmark-expansion|title=Maple Landmark Expansion|website=Addison County Economic Development Corporation|language=en-us|access-date=2017-06-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.businessvermont.com/maple-landmarks-growth-leads-to-expansion/|title=Maple Landmark’s growth leads to expansion|work=Business Vermont|access-date=2017-06-16|language=en-US}}</ref> The three-year project allowed for more production and packing and [[shipping]] space.
The Vermont [[Small Business Administration]] named Mike Rainville the Vermont Small Business Person of the Year for 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://vermontbiz.com/news/march/michael-rainville-maple-landmark-named-vermont-small-business-person-year|title=Michael Rainville of Maple Landmark named Vermont Small Business Person of the Year {{!}} Vermont Business Magazine|website=vermontbiz.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-15}}</ref> Also in 2017, Andrew Rainville, Mike's younger son, returned to the business after studying at [[Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://news.rpi.edu/content/2017/05/08/commencement-2017-importance-creativity-and-critical-thinking-business|title=Commencement 2017: The Importance of Creativity and Critical Thinking in Business and Management|last=Tracy|first=Julie|date=2017-05-08|website=RPI News|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-07-13}}</ref>
==Products==
Maple Landmark crafts a wide variety of wooden products from toys, to games, to gifts. Some product lines include NameTrains, Wooden Railway System, Hang-A-Name, Montgomery Schoolhouse, Schoolhouse Naturals, Solace, and [[Roger Tory Peterson|Peterson]] Birds. == Affiliations == {{Coord|44|2|11.4|N|73|10|1.3|W|display=title}}Maple Landmark is affiliated with many industry and regional organizations such as the Vermont Wood Manufacturer's Association, Wood Products Manufacturing Association, American Specialty Toy Retailing Association (ASTRA), Vermont Chamber of Commerce, Vermont Attractions Association, and Addison County Chamber of Commerce.

The '''JCM800''' series (Models 1959, 1987, 2203, 2204, 2210 and 2205) is a line of [[guitar amplifier]]s made by [[Marshall Amplification]]. The series was introduced in 1981. Although models 1959 and 1987 had been in production since 1965 and the 2203 and 2204 had been in production since 1975, they were redesigned and introduced as JCM800 amplifiers in '81. The JCM800 amplifiers became a staple of 1980s hard rock and heavy metal bands.
==History== In 1981, Marshall finally reached the end of its 15-year distribution deal with [[Rose-Morris]], which had severely limited its potential to sell amplifiers outside England; Rose-Morris tagged 55% onto the sticker price for exported models. The JCM800 was the first series produced after the contract expired. The name comes from [[Jim Marshall (businessman)|Jim Marshall]]'s initials, "J.C.M.", coupled with the meaningless "800" from the [[Vehicle registration plate|number plate]] on his car. It was later noted that "800" stood for the decade. For example, the JCM900 was released in 1990 and the JCM2000 was released in 2000.<ref name=maloof>{{cite book|last=Maloof|first=Rich|title=Jim Marshall, father of loud: the story of the man behind the worlds most famous guitar amplifiers|year=2004|publisher=Hal Leonard|isbn=978-0-87930-803-2|pages=211–14|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mLmpGbR_n0AC&pg=PA211}}</ref>
The series included head amplifiers with matching cabinets, as well as combos, and was produced until the 1990s.<ref name=maloof/> It quickly became a very successful amplifier, and ubiquitous amongst [[hard rock]] and [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] bands.<ref name=pittman>{{cite book|last=Pittman|first=Aspen|title=The Tube Amp Book|year=2003|publisher=Hal Leonard|isbn=978-0-87930-767-7|pages=75|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=JT1I7Ld76YsC&pg=PA74}}</ref>
==Description== These were the second series of Marshalls equipped with a master volume, which allowed for more distortion at lower volumes. Compared to the earlier "Master Volume" series, they offered some advantages, including the possibility to be patched internally and linked with other amplifiers.<ref name=boehnlein/> The first JCM800s were in fact Master Volume amplifiers (Models 2203 and 2204, at 100 and 50 watts respectively), repackaged in new boxes with new panels. Soon, however, the Model 2210 appeared on the market.<ref name=fliegler>{{cite book|last=Fliegler|first=Ritchie|title=Amps!: the other half of rock 'n' roll|year=1993|publisher=Hal Leonard|isbn=978-0-7935-2411-2|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NgG8bmBayLwC&pg=PA47|author2=Jon F. Eiche|page=46}}</ref> These were equipped with two channels, which could be activated via a foot switch, allowing for separate lead and rhythm sounds. They also had an [[Effect unit|effects loop]] and [[reverb]], also a first for Marshall.<ref name=pittman/>
Initially, users complained that the amplifiers (used with the standard Marshall cabinets) sounded flat compared to the older Marshalls, until it was discovered (by accident) that the fault was with the speakers: The new cabs had been equipped with a new kind of [[Celestion]] speakers. Marshall quickly reverted to the older Celestions.<ref name=pittman/> Still, some users prefer the pre-JCM800 amplifiers, claiming that those have a warmer, less "brittle" sound.<ref name=boehnlein>{{cite book|last=Boehnlein|first=John|title=The High Performance Marshall Handbook: A Guide to Great Marshall Amplifier Sounds|year=1998|publisher=Bold Strummer|isbn=978-0-933224-80-3|pages=10–12|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vm00dXNS30IC&pg=PA11}}</ref>
The amplifier was equipped with [[EL34]] [[Vacuum tube|valves (tubes)]] for amps sold in the UK and [[6550]] tubes for amps exported to the United States.<ref name=boehnlein/> The JCM800 is considered a "hot" amplifier because it has more [[Gain (electronics)|gain]] stages than comparable amplifiers, and in "lead" mode (in the "high" input), an extra [[triode]] provides extra gain to the pre-amplifier, which "made for one hot rock amp".<ref name=hunter>{{cite book|last=Hunter|first=Dave|title=The guitar amp handbook: understanding tube amplifiers and getting great sounds|year=2005|publisher=Hal Leonard|isbn=978-0-87930-863-6|pages=46–47}}</ref>

[[File:Navy Meritorious Unit Commendation ribbon.svg|23px|border]] [[Meritorious Unit Commendation]] }} '''Michael Gerard Grimm''' (born February 7, 1970){{cite web|title=Rep. Michael G. Grimm (R-N.Y.)|url=http://www.rollcall.com/members/32707.html|website=Roll Call|publisher=Congressional Quarterly|accessdate=July 24, 2014}} is an American businessman, convicted felon, [[United States Marine Corps|Marine Corps]] veteran and politician who represented New York in the [[United States Congress]] from 2011 to 2015. Grimm represented [[New York's 13th congressional district]] during his first term, after which he represented [[New York's 11th congressional district]]. Both districts consisted of [[Staten Island]] and parts of [[Brooklyn]]. Grimm is a member of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]], and during his time in office was the only Republican to represent a significant portion of [[New York City]]. On April 28, 2014, Grimm was charged by federal authorities with 20 counts of fraud, federal tax evasion, and perjury.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/29/nyregion/representative-michael-grimm-is-indicted-on-fraud-charges.html|title=Grimm, Staten Island Congressman, Is Indicted on Fraud Charges|last=Clifford|first=Stephanie|publisher=New York Times|date=April 29, 2014}} On December 23, 2014, he pleaded guilty to a single count of felony tax fraud, and "acknowledged committing perjury, hiring illegal immigrants, and committing wire fraud".{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/24/nyregion/rep-michael-grimm-pleads-guilty-to-tax-fraud.html?_r=0|title=Rep. Michael Grimm Pleads Guilty but Says He Won't Resign|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=May 6, 2015}} After initially vowing to retain his seat, Grimm announced on December 30, 2014, that he would resign from Congress effective January 5, 2015.{{cite web|title=Michael Grimm: NY Congressman resigns after guilty plea|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-30636320|website=BBC News|publisher=|accessdate=December 30, 2014}} On May 5, 2015, [[Daniel M. Donovan, Jr.]] won the [[New York's 11th congressional district special election, 2015|special election]] to replace Grimm. On July 17, 2015, Grimm was sentenced to eight months in prison for tax evasion.{{cite web|title=Ex-Rep. Grimm sentenced to 8 months in prison in tax evasion case|url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2015/07/17/ex-rep-grimm-sentenced-to-8-months-in-prison-in-tax-evasion-case/|website=Fox News|publisher=|accessdate=July 17, 2015}} He began his prison term on September 22, 2015 after a brief delay for medical treatments.{{cite news|last1=Marzulli|first1=John|title=Michael Grimm, disgraced Staten Island congressman, to begin prison sentence for filing false tax returns|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/michael-grimm-start-8-month-prison-sentence-pa-article-1.2369719|accessdate=February 16, 2016|work=[[Daily News (New York)]]|publisher=[[Mortimer Zuckerman]]|date=September 22, 2015}} On October 1, 2017, Grimm launched a campaign to attempt to win back his old House seat in New York's 11th District. On June 26, 2018, he lost in the Republican primary.{{cite web|url=https://www.apnews.com/d31a05537f064778b837fdfa6606c23e/Ex-Rep.-Grimm-eyeing-Congress-comeback-after-tax-fraud-plea|title=Ex-Rep. Grimm eyeing Congress comeback after tax fraud plea|publisher=[[Associated Press]]|last=Peltz|first=Jennifer|date=October 1, 2017|accessdate=October 1, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/disgraced-rep-disclose-new-run-not-paid-huge-debt-article-1.3532627|title=Tax-evading ex-Rep. Michael Grimm to reveal bid for old seat, but not how he suddenly paid off $570G debt|publisher=''[[New York Daily News]]''|last=Jorgensen|first=Jillian|last2=Smith|first2=Greg B.|date=September 30, 2017|accessdate=October 1, 2017}} ==Early life and education== Grimm was raised as a Catholic in [[Queens, New York]], the son of Petrina (née Castronova) and Gerard Grimm. He is of German, Irish, and Sicilian descent.{{cite web|author=Staten Island Advance/Jan Somma-Hammel|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/11/grimm_living_his_fairy_tale.html|title=Michael Grimm, now congressman-elect, is living his fairy tale|publisher=SILive.com|date=November 4, 2010|accessdate=July 15, 2014}} He graduated from [[Archbishop Molloy High School]] in 1988.{{cite news|last1=Barnard|first1=Anne|title=Rising G.O.P. Star From Staten Island Draws on Political Gifts to Fend Off Critics|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/03/09/nyregion/michael-grimm-gop-congressman-fights-critics.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0|accessdate=July 3, 2014|publisher=New York Times|date=March 8, 2012}} Grimm entered active duty with the [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marine Corps]] in 1989. He received a combat promotion to [[corporal]], and was awarded the [[Combat Action Ribbon]], [[Navy Unit Commendation]], the [[Meritorious Unit Commendation]], among other awards.{{citation needed|date=November 2014}} Grimm received a [[BBA]] in [[accounting]] from [[Baruch College]] in 1994. He transferred to the U.S. Marine Corps Reserve and was discharged from service in 1997.{{citation needed|date=November 2014}} He received a [[Juris Doctor]] ''([[magna cum laude]]'') from [[New York Law School]] in 2002.{{cite news|first=Alicia|last=Colon|title=Inexplicable behavior by the Island GOP chairman|date=June 6, 2010|url=http://www.silive.com/opinion/columns/index.ssf/2010/06/inexplicable_behavior_by_the_i.html|work=SILive.com|accessdate=January 29, 2014}} ==Career== ===Federal Bureau of Investigation (1991–2006)=== Grimm entered the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] as a clerk in 1991. In 1995, he entered the [[FBI Academy]] in [[Quantico Station, Virginia]]. He graduated as a [[Special Agent|special agent]] and was certified to become an [[undercover agent]]. He transitioned into undercover agent work, eventually working in the FBI [[Gambino crime family|Gambino]] Squad, and was assigned to the inside activities of [[Peter Gotti]], [[John Gotti]]'s brother.{{cite web|last=Saltonstall|first=David|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/2009/11/15/2009-11-15_fbis_mikey_suits_aims_for_congress_exundercover_mafia_buster_seeks_si_seat.html|title=Ex-undercover Mafia buster, Michael 'Mikey Suits' Grimm, seeks Staten Island congressional seat|publisher=New York Daily News|date=November 14, 2009|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} Grimm worked for the FBI as an agent for 9 years. In 2011, [[Evan Ratliff]], writing for ''[[The New Yorker]]'', reported that Grimm had been the subject of an internal investigation into allegations that he abused his authority as a FBI agent in a nightclub in 1999.{{cite web|last=Ratliff|first=Evan|title=The Mark: The F.B.I. Needs Informants, but What Happens When They Go Too Far?|date=May 2, 2011|publisher=New Yorker|url=http://www.newyorker.com/reporting/2011/05/02/110502fa_fact_ratliff?currentPage=all|accessdate=January 29, 2014}}{{cite web|last=Ratliff|first=Evan|url=http://www.newyorker.com/online/blogs/newsdesk/2011/04/congressman-michael-grimm-at-the-caribbean-tropics.html|title=Congressman Grimm and the Night Club|publisher=The New Yorker|date=April 29, 2011|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} At the time of the'' New Yorker'' report, the [[New York City Police Department]] and U.S. Justice Department had not released documents regarding the alleged incident. Grimm stated that the incident had been fully investigated and that he had been cleared of all allegations.{{cite web|last=Tracy|first=Thomas|url=http://www.brooklynpaper.com/stories/34/18/all_grimmdeblasio_2011_5_6_bk.html|title=DeBlasio to Grimm: Come clean about 1999 bar fight|publisher=The Brooklyn Paper|date=April 28, 2011|accessdate=April 5, 2012}}{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Ben|url=http://www.politico.com/blogs/bensmith/0411/The_FBI_agent_and_the_night_club.html|title=The FBI agent and the night club|publisher=Politico|date=April 25, 2011|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} During his time with the FBI, Grimm spent two years posing as a small-cap stockbroker, uncovering white-collar criminals on [[Wall Street]]. According to Grimm, the firm was involved in [[money laundering]], making false trades, and manipulating stocks.{{cite news| url=http://nation.foxnews.com/rep-michael-grimm/2011/01/19/meet-undercover-fbi-agent-turned-freshman-congressman | work=Fox News | title=Meet the Undercover FBI Agent-Turned-Freshman Congressman – Rep. Michael Grimm – Fox Nation | date=January 19, 2011}} After building a strong case for two years, he and the firm's partners were arrested together, at which point the police informed the group that they had been infiltrated by an undercover agent. Grimm stated in 2011 that he has long been aware of the possibility that people may try to take revenge on him.{{cite web|last=Heil |first=Emily |url=http://www.rollcall.com/issues/56_66/-202382-1.html |title=Threats Not New for Former Lawmen |publisher=Roll Call |date=January 12, 2011 |accessdate=April 5, 2012}} He left the FBI in 2006, citing his exhaustion from working long hours.{{cite web|last=Randall |first=Judy L. |url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/07/gulf_war_vet_former_fbi_agent.html |title=Gulf War vet, former FBI agent has 'a burning desire to serve' |publisher=Staten Island Advance |date=July 11, 2010 |accessdate=April 5, 2012}} ===Business and finance (2006–2010)=== Before joining the FBI, Grimm worked for a year for Whale Securities,{{cite news|last1=Cowan|first1=Alison Leigh|last2=Barnard|first2=Anne|last3=Rashbaum|first3=William K.|title=Congressman's Business Ties Are at Odds with Upright Image|date=February 15, 2012|accessdate=September 18, 2013|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/02/16/nyregion/michael-grimms-business-ties-are-at-odds-with-upright-image.html|publisher=N.Y. Times}} an investment banking firm.{{cite web|title=Company Overview of Whale Securities Co., L.P.|publisher=Bloomberg Businessweek|accessdate=September 18, 2013|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=1062802}} Shortly before leaving the bureau, Grimm invested in a luxury Texas development. In 2006, Grimm founded a small [[health food restaurant]] in [[Manhattan, New York|Manhattan]] called Healthalicious.{{cite web|url=http://www.whorunsgov.com/Profiles/Michael_Grimm|title=Michael Grimm (R-N.Y.)|publisher=Whorunsgov.com|accessdate=April 5, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111020061545/http://www.whorunsgov.com/Profiles/Michael_Grimm|archivedate=October 20, 2011|df=mdy-all}} He co-owned and served as principal and [[chief executive officer]] of Austin Refuel Transport, an [[Austin, Texas]]-based [[bio-fuel]] company.{{cite web|url=http://grimm.house.gov/about-me/full-biography|title=About Me: Full Biography|publisher=Grimm.house.gov|accessdate=April 5, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120421165517/http://grimm.house.gov/about-me/full-biography|archivedate=April 21, 2012|df=mdy-all}} As of 2011, Grimm owned 28% of the company, although he is no longer involved in daily operations nor is he CEO. In July 2011, the ''[[New York Daily News]]'' reported that Austin Refuel Transport had received 11 safety violations in two [[U.S. Department of Transportation]] checkups.{{cite news|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2011-07-17/news/29800917_1_grimm-safety-violations-biodiesel|location=New York|work=Daily News|title=Holiday shopping: Tips to find the best deals on Cyber Monday 2010|first=Benjamin|last=Lesser|date=July 17, 2011}} Grimm's spokesman said that he now "has no authority or managerial role in the daily activities of the company. He is simply a silent investor."{{cite news|last1=Lesser|first1=Benjamin|title=Rep. Michael Grimm's trucking business racks up toxic safety violations, raises interest questions|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/rep-michael-grimm-trucking-business-racks-toxic-safety-violations-raises-interest-questions-article-1.162227|accessdate=July 3, 2014|publisher=New York Daily News|date=July 17, 2011}} ===U.S. House of Representatives (2011–2015)=== [[File:NLN Michael Grimm.jpg|thumb|Grimm greets spectators on Memorial Day]] ====Elections==== =====2010===== {{See also|United States House of Representatives elections in New York, 2010#District 13*}} Grimm launched his campaign for the 13th New York Congressional District seat on January 23, 2010.{{cite web|last=Wrobleski|first=Tom|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/01/republican_michael_grimm_launc.html|title=Republican Michael Grimm launches campaign against McMahon on Staten Island|publisher=Staten Island Advance|date=January 23, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} He was endorsed by former [[NYC mayor]] [[Rudy Giuliani]] as well as [[Guy Molinari]], a former U.S. Representative and [[Staten Island]] [[Borough President]].{{cite web|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/02/former_mayor_rudy_giuliani_to.html |title=Former Mayor Rudy Giuliani to endorse GOP congressional candidate Michael Grimm|publisher=Staten Island Advance|date=February 18, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} He was also endorsed by the [[Conservative Party of New York State]]. He was challenged by Michael Allegretti who was endorsed by former six-term U.S. Representative [[Vito Fossella]], the [[Staten Island]] Republican Party,{{cite web |last=Saltonstall |first=David |title= Staten Island GOP Committee Endorses Michael Allegretti for Vito Fossella's Old Congressional Seat |date= May 28, 2010 |publisher= N.Y. Daily News |url= http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/staten-island-gop-committee-endorses-michael-allegretti-vito-fossella-old-congressional-seat-article-1.449479}} State Senator [[Andrew Lanza]], and State Assemblyman [[Lou Tobacco]].{{cite web|last=Wroblewski|first=Tom|title=Allegretti Collects Endorsements from Lanza and Tobacco|publisher=Staten Island Advance|date=June 4, 2010|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/06/allegretti_collects_endorsemen.html}} Allegretti worked for the nonprofit [[Climate Group]] and cited his relationships with NYC Mayor [[Michael R. Bloomberg]] and former [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]] [[Tony Blair]].{{cite news|last=Hernandez|first=Raymond|title= The City: Fight for Staten Island|publisher=New York Times|date=October 23, 2009|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/10/25/nyregion/25bcongressmb.html?_r=0}} Grimm chose not to contest the Staten Island's party endorsement because of their "corrupt political culture" and "sham convention."{{cite web|last=Slajda|first=Rachel|title=Staten Island GOP, Deprived of Fossella, Chooses Allegretti|date=May 28, 2010|publisher=TPM|url=http://tpmdc.talkingpointsmemo.com/2010/05/staten-island-gop-deprived-of-fossella-chooses-allegretti.php}} Grimm's primary win was divisive for the Republican Party leadership, which favored Allegretti.{{cite web|last=Wrobleski|first=Tom|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/10/staten_island_gops_endorsement.html|title=Staten Island GOP's endorsement of Grimm is less than resounding|publisher=Staten Island Advance|date=October 6, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} His campaign gained national attention from the Tea Party and the National Republican Congressional Committee, which contributed $90,000 to Grimm's campaign.{{cite web|url=http://dailycaller.com/2010/10/21/thedc-interview-republican-new-york-congressional-candidate-michael-grimm|title=TheDC Interview: Republican New York congressional candidate Michael Grimm|publisher=Daily Caller|date=October 21, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} He received endorsements from high-profile Republicans, including Giuliani,{{cite web|first=Peter N.|last=Spencer|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/10/giuliani_buoys_grimm_at_whiteh.html|title=Giuliani buoys Grimm at Whitehall Ferry Terminal|publisher=Staten Island Advance|date=October 29, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} [[John McCain]], [[Sarah Palin]],{{cite news|last=Chen|first=David W.|title=Results Are Mixed for Tea Party in New York|date=September 15, 2010|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/09/15/nyregion/15nytea.html|publisher=New York Times}}(coverage of the Grimm vs. McMahon race) and former President [[George H.W. Bush]], who applauded his service in the Gulf War.{{cite web|last=Wrobleski|first=Tom|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/10/former_president_george_bush_e.html|title=Former President George Bush endorses Michael Grimm|publisher=Staten Island Advance|date=October 9, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} Grimm faced incumbent [[Michael McMahon]] in the general election. On October 12, the ''[[Staten Island Advance]]'' reported that it had been receiving emails from the McMahon campaign attacking Grimm's business credentials.{{cite web|first=Judy L.|last=Randall|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/10/mcmahon_peppers_advance_with_e.html|title=Staten Island Rep. McMahon peppers Advance with e-mails that rip Grimm|publisher=Staten Island Advance|date=October 12, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} The emails claimed that Grimm's real-estate and restaurant investments were failures despite Grimm's repeated insistence that they were successful.{{cite web|last=Patten|first=David A.|date=October 24, 2010|title=2010: Democrats Set Records for Dirtiest Election Ever|publisher=Newsmax|url=http://www.newsmax.com/Newsfront/campaign-dirty-tricks-tea/2010/10/24/id/374719}} Grimm reportedly admitted in an interview with the ''Staten Island Advance'' that his former restaurant in Manhattan, Healthalicious, had been on the verge of bankruptcy, forcing him to sell his stake in it. A major difference between the two candidates was the issue of the U.S. economic stimulus package, which the ''Advance'' called the "starkest contrast" among the two candidates. Grimm stated that the stimulus was a "huge waste" of taxpayer money and ineffective in generating job creation and economic recovery, whereas McMahon cited improvements in the state budget and renovations on the Staten Island Expressway and the Saint George Ferry Terminal as direct successes of the stimulus.{{cite web|last=Wrobleski|first=Tom|url=http://www.silive.com/news/index.ssf/2010/10/stimulus_a_political_football.html|title=Stimulus dollars become political football in Staten Island congressional race|publisher=Staten Island Advance|date=October 11, 2010|accessdate=April 5, 2012}} On November 2, 2010, Grimm defeated McMahon in the race, 51% to 48%. The ''Advance'' reported that Grimm won in large part due to his political signs, which became popular among his supporters. [[File:Mixed Acid Fermentation in E. coli.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The '''Mixed Acid Fermentation Pathway''' in ''E. coli''.<ref name="Keseler2011" /><ref name="Förster2014" /> End products are highlighted in blue.]]
'''Mixed acid fermentation''' is the biological process by which a six-carbon sugar e.g. [[glucose]] is converted into a complex and variable mixture of acids. It is an [[wikt:anaerobic|anaerobic]] [[fermentation]] reaction that is common in bacteria. It is characteristic for members of the [[Enterobacteriaceae]], a large family of Gram-negative bacteria that includes ''[[Escherichia coli|E. coli]]''.<ref name=" Madigan&Martinko2006">{{Cite journal | author=M.Magidan & J. Martinko | title=Brock's Biology of Microorganisms, NJ, Pearson Prentice Hall | volume=11 | year=2006 | page=352}}</ref>
The mixture of end products produced by mixed acid fermentation includes [[lactic acid|lactate]], [[acetate]], [[succinate]], [[formate]], [[ethanol]] and the gases H<sub>2</sub> and CO<sub>2</sub>. The formation of these end products depends on the presence of certain key [[enzyme]]s in the bacterium. The proportion in which they are formed varies between different bacterial species.<ref name=" Sharma2007">{{Cite journal | author=Sharma, P.D. | title=Microbiology | year=2007 | page=104}}</ref> The mixed acid fermentation pathway differs from other fermentation pathways, which produce fewer end products in fixed amounts. The end products of mixed acid fermentation can have many useful applications in [[biotechnology]] and [[industrial fermentation|industry]]. For instance, ethanol is widely used as a [[biofuel]].<ref name="Farrell2006">{{Cite journal | author=Farrell, Alexander E. | title=Ethanol can contribute to energy and environmental goals |journal=[[Science (journal)|Science]] | volume=311 | issue=5760 | year = 2006 | pages=506–508 | doi=10.1126/science.1121416 |display-authors=etal | pmid=16439656}}</ref> Therefore, multiple bacterial strains have been [[metabolic engineering|metabolically engineered]] in the laboratory to increase the individual [[yield (chemistry)|yields]] of certain end products.<ref name="Förster2014">{{Cite journal |author1=Förster, Andreas H. |author2=Johannes Gescher |lastauthoramp=yes | title=Metabolic engineering of Escherichia coli for production of mixed-acid fermentation end products | journal=[[Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology]] | volume=2 | year=2014 | pages=506–508 | doi=10.3389/fbioe.2014.00016|pmid=25152889 |pmc=4126452 }}</ref> This research has been carried out primarily in ''E. coli'' and is ongoing.
==Mixed Acid Fermentation in ''E. coli''== ''E. coli'' use fermentation pathways as a final option for energy metabolism, as they produce very little energy in comparison to respiration.<ref name="Sawers2004">{{Cite journal | author=Sawers, R. Gary, Melanie Blokesch, and August Böck | title=Anaerobic formate and hydrogen metabolism | journal=[[EcoSal Plus]] | volume=1.1 | issue=1 | year=2004 | doi=10.1128/ecosalplus.3.5.4| pmid=26443350 }}</ref> Mixed acid fermentation in ''E. coli'' occurs in two stages. These stages are outlined by the biological database for ''E. coli'', [[EcoCyc]].<ref name="Keseler2011">{{Cite journal | author=Keseler, Ingrid M. | title=EcoCyc: a comprehensive database of Escherichia coli biology | journal=[[Nucleic Acids Research]] | volume= 39| issue=Database issue | year=2011 | doi=10.1093/nar/gkq1143|display-authors=etal | pmid=21097882 | pmc=3013716 | pages=D583–D590}}</ref>
The first of these two stages is a [[glycolysis reaction]]. Under anaerobic conditions, a glycolysis reaction takes place where glucose is converted into [[Pyruvic acid|pyruvate]]:
      glucose → 2 pyruvate
There is a net production of 2 [[Adenosine triphosphate|ATP]] and 2 [[Nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide|NADH]] molecules per molecule of glucose converted. ATP is generated by [[substrate-level phosphorylation]]. NADH is formed from the [[Redox|reduction]] of NAD.
In the second stage, pyruvate produced by glycolysis is converted to one or more end products via the following reactions. In each case, both of the NADH molecules generated by glycolysis are [[wikt:reoxidize|reoxidized]] to NAD<sup>+</sup>. Each alternative pathway requires a different key enzyme in ''E. coli''. After the variable amounts of different end products are formed by these pathways, they are secreted from the cell.<ref name="Keseler2011" />
[[File:Reaction catalyzed by lactate dehydrogenase.png|thumb|300px|The conversion of pyruvate to lactate is catalysed by the enzyme '''[[lactate dehydrogenase]]'''.]]
===Lactate Formation=== Pyruvate produced by glycolysis is converted to [[lactic acid|lactate]]. This reaction is [[catalysis|catalysed]] by the enzyme '''[[lactate dehydrogenase]] (LDHA)'''.<ref name="Keseler2011" />
      pyruvate + NADH + H<sup>+</sup> → '''lactate''' + NAD<sup>+</sup>
===Acetate Formation=== Pyruvate is converted into [[acetyl-CoA|acetyl-coenzyme A (acetyl-CoA)]] by the enzyme [[pyruvate dehydrogenase]]. This acetyl-CoA is then converted into [[acetate]] in ''E. coli'', whilst producing ATP by [[substrate-level phosphorylation]]. Acetate formation requires two enzymes: '''phosphate acetyltransferase''' and '''acetate kinase'''.<ref name="Keseler2011" /> [[File:EscherichiaColi NIAID.jpg|thumb|300px|The Mixed Acid Fermentation pathway is characteristic of the '''[[Enterobacteriaceae]]''' family that includes ''E. coli'']]
      acetyl-CoA + phosphate → acetyl-phosphate + CoA
      acetyl-phosphate + ADP → '''acetate''' + ATP
===Ethanol Formation=== [[Ethanol]] is formed in ''E. coli'' by the reduction of acetyl coenzyme A using NADH. This two-step reaction requires the enzyme '''[[alcohol dehydrogenase]] (ADHE).'''<ref name="Keseler2011" />
      acetyl-CoA + NADH + H<sup>+</sup> → acetaldehyde + NAD<sup>+</sup> + CoA
      acetaldehyde + NADH + H<sup>+</sup> → '''ethanol''' + NAD<sup>+</sup>
===Formate Formation=== [[Formate]] is produced by the [[Bond cleavage|cleavage]] of pyruvate. This reaction is catalysed by the enzyme '''[[Formate C-acetyltransferase|pyruvate-formate lyase]] (PFL)''', which plays an important role in regulating anaerobic fermentation in ''E. coli''.<ref name="Knappe1990">{{Cite journal |author1=Knappe, Joachim |author2=Gary Sawers |lastauthoramp=yes | title=A radical-chemical route to acetyl-CoA: the anaerobically induced pyruvate formate-lyase system of Escherichia coli | journal=[[FEMS microbiology reviews]] | volume=6.4 |issue=4 | year=1990 | pages = 383–398 | doi=10.1111/j.1574-6968.1990.tb04108.x}}</ref>
      pyruvate + CoA → acetyl-CoA + '''formate'''
===Succinate Formation=== [[File:Bernsteinsäure2.svg|thumb|300px|Skeletal structure of [[succinate]]]] [[Succinate]] is formed in ''E. coli'' in several steps.
[[Phosphoenolpyruvic acid|Phosphoenolpyruvate]] (PEP), a glycolysis pathway [[Reaction intermediate|intermediate]], is [[Carboxylation|carboxylated]] by the enzyme [[Phosphoenolpyruvate carboxylase|PEP carboxylase]] to form [[Oxaloacetic acid|oxaloacetate]].<ref name="Kai2003">{{Cite journal | author=Kai, Yasushi, Hiroyoshi Matsumura, and Katsura Izui | title=Phosphoenolpyruvate carboxylase: three-dimensional structure and molecular mechanisms | journal=[[Archives of Biochemistry and Biophysics]] | volume= 414| issue=2 | year=2003 | pages = 170–179 | doi=10.1016/S0003-9861(03)00170-X | pmid=12781768}}</ref> This is followed by the conversion of oxaloacetate to [[Malic acid|malate]] by the enzyme [[malate dehydrogenase]]. [[Fumarase|Fumarate hydratase]] then catalyses the dehydration of malate to produce [[Fumaric acid|fumarate]].<ref name="Thakker2012">{{Cite journal | author=Thakker, Chandresh | title=Succinate production in Escherichia coli | journal=[[Biotechnology journal]] | volume=7.2 | issue=2 | year=2012 | pages = 213–224 | doi=10.1002/biot.201100061| pmid=21932253 |display-authors=etal| pmc=3517001 }}</ref>
      phosphoenolpyruvate + HCO<sub>3</sub> → oxaloacetate + phosphate
      oxaloacetate + NADH + H<sup>+</sup> → malate + NAD<sup>+</sup>
      malate → fumarate + H<sub>2</sub>0
The final reaction in the formation of succinate is the reduction of fumarate. It is catalysed by the enzyme '''[[fumarate reductase]]'''.
      fumarate + NADH + H<sup>+</sup> → '''succinate''' + NAD<sup>+</sup>
This reduction is an anaerobic respiration reaction in ''E. coli'', as it uses electrons associated with NADH dehydrogenase and the [[electron transport chain]]. ATP is generated by using an [[electrochemical gradient]] and [[ATP synthase]]. This is the only case in the mixed acid fermentation pathway where ATP is not produced via substrate-level phosphorylation.<ref name="Keseler2011" /><ref name="Förster2014" />
[[Vitamin K|Vitamin K<sub>2</sub>]], also known as menaquinone, is very important for electron transport to fumarate in ''E. coli''.<ref name="Guest1977">{{Cite journal | author=Guest, JOHN R | title=Menaquinone biosynthesis: mutants of Escherichia coli K-12 requiring 2-succinylbenzoate | journal=[[Journal of Bacteriology]] | volume=130.3 | year=1977 | pages = 1038–1046}}</ref>
===Hydrogen and Carbon Dioxide Formation=== Formate can be converted to hydrogen gas and carbon dioxide in ''E. coli''. This reaction requires the enzyme '''[http://biocyc.org/ECOLI/NEW-IMAGE?type=ENZYME&object=FHLMULTI-CPLX formate-hydrogen lyase]'''. It can be used to prevent the conditions inside the cell becoming too acidic.<ref name="Keseler2011" />
      formate → '''H<sub>2</sub>''' and '''CO<sub>2</sub>'''
==Methyl Red Test== [[File:Methylrot Probe methyl red test.jpg|thumb|200px|'''[[Methyl Red]] Test''': The test tube on the left shows a positive result as acidic end products are formed by mixed acid fermentation in ''E. coli''. The test tube on the right shows a negative result as no acidic products are formed by fermentation.]]
The '''[[methyl red]] (MR)''' test can detect whether the mixed acid fermentation pathway occurs in microbes when given glucose. A [[pH indicator]] is used that turns the test solution red if the pH drops below 4.4.<ref name="Clarke1922">{{Cite journal |author1=H. T. Clarke |author2=W. R. Kirner | title=Methyl Red | journal=[[Org. Synth.]] | volume=2 | year=1922 | pages = 47 | doi=10.15227/orgsyn.002.0047}}</ref> If the fermentation pathway has taken place, the mixture of acids it has produced will make the solution very acidic and cause a red colour change.
The Methyl red test belongs to a group known as the [[IMViC]] tests.
==Metabolic Engineering== Multiple bacterial strains have been [[Metabolic engineering|metabolically engineered]] to increase the individual yields of end products formed by mixed acid fermentation. For instance, strains for the increased production of ethanol, lactate, succinate and acetate have been developed due to the usefulness of these products in [[biotechnology]].<ref name="Förster2014" /> The major limiting factor for this engineering is the need to maintain a [[redox]] balance in the mixture of acids produced by the fermentation pathway.<ref name="vanHoek2012">{{Cite journal |author1=van Hoek |author2=Milan JA |author3=Roeland MH Merks |last-author-amp=yes | title=Redox balance is key to explaining full vs. partial switching to low-yield metabolism | journal=[[BMC Systems Biology]] | volume=6.1 | year=2012 | page = 22 | doi=10.1186/1752-0509-6-22|pmid=22443685 |pmc=3384451 }}</ref>
===For ethanol production=== Ethanol is the most commonly used [[biofuel]] and can be produced on large scale via fermentation. The maximum theoretical [[yield (chemistry)|yield]] for the production of ethanol was achieved around 20 years.<ref name="Ingram1987">{{Cite journal | author= Ingram, L. O. | title= Genetic engineering of ethanol production in Escherichia coli | journal=[[Applied and Environmental Microbiology]] | volume=53:10 | year=1987 | pages = 2420–2425|display-authors=etal}}</ref><ref name="Ohta1991">{{Cite journal | author= Ohta, Kazuyoshi | title= Genetic improvement of Escherichia coli for ethanol production: chromosomal integration of Zymomonas mobilis genes encoding pyruvate decarboxylase and alcohol dehydrogenase II | journal=[[Applied and Environmental Microbiology]] | volume=57.4 | year=1991 | pages = 893–900|display-authors=etal}}</ref> A plasmid that carried the pyruvate decarboxylase and alcohol dehydrogenase genes from the bacteria ''[[Zymomonas mobilis|Z.mobilis]]'' was used by scientists. This was inserted into ''E. coli'' and resulted in an increased yield of ethanol. The genome of this ''E. coli'' strain, KO11, has more recently been sequenced and mapped.<ref name="Turner2012">{{Cite journal | author=Turner, Peter C. | title=Optical mapping and sequencing of the Escherichia coli KO11 genome reveal extensive chromosomal rearrangements, and multiple tandem copies of the Zymomonas mobilis pdc and adhB genes | journal=[[Journal of industrial microbiology & biotechnology]] | volume=39.4 | issue=4 | year=2012 | pages = 629–639|display-authors=etal | doi=10.1007/s10295-011-1052-2| pmid=22075923 }}</ref>
[[File:Polylactid sceletal.svg|thumb|200px|The skeletal formula of [[Polylactid acid]]]] [[File:Teebeutel Polylactid 2009.jpg|thumb|200px|Teabags made from Polylactic acid (PLA)]]
===For acetate production=== The ''E. coli'' strain W3110 was [[genetic engineering|genetically engineered]] to generate 2 moles of acetate for every 1 mole of glucose that undergoes fermentation. This is known as a homoacetate pathway.<ref name="Causey2003">{{Cite journal | author=Causey, T. B. | title=Engineering the metabolism of Escherichia coli W3110 for the conversion of sugar to redox-neutral and oxidized products: homoacetate production | journal=[[Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences]] | volume= 100| issue=3 | year=2003 | pages = 825–832 | doi=10.1073/pnas.0337684100|display-authors=etal | pmid=12556564 | pmc=298686}}</ref>
===For lactate production=== Lactate can be used to produce a [[bioplastic]] called [[Polylactic acid]] (PLA). The properties of PLA depend on the ratio of the two '''[[isomer|optical isomers]]''' of lactate (D-lactate and L-lactate). D-lactate is produced by mixed acid fermentation in ''E. coli.''<ref name="Clark1989">{{Cite journal | author= Clark, David P | title= The fermentation pathways of Escherichia coli | journal=[[FEMS Microbiology Reviews]] | volume=5.3 | issue= 3 | year=1989 | pages = 223–234 | doi= 10.1111/j.1574-6968.1989.tb03398.x}}</ref> Early experiments engineered the E.coli strain RR1 to produce either one of the two optical isomers of lactate.<ref name="Chang1999">{{Cite journal | author=Chang, Dong-Eun | title=Homofermentative production of d-orl-lactate in metabolically engineered Escherichia coli RR1 | journal=[[Applied and Environmental Microbiology]] | volume=65.4 | year=1999 | pages = 1384–1389 |display-authors=etal}}</ref>
Later experiments modified the ''E. coli strain'' KO11, originally developed to enhance ethanol production. Scientists were able to increase the yield of D-lactate from fermentation by performing several [[Deletion (genetics)|deletions]].<ref name="Zhou2005">{{Cite journal | author= Zhou, S. | title= Fermentation of 10%(w/v) sugar to D (−)-lactate by engineered Escherichia coli B | journal=[[Biotechnology letters]] | volume=27 | issue= 23–24 | year=2005 | pages = 1891–1896 | doi= 10.1007/s10529-005-3899-7 | pmid= 16328986 |display-authors=etal}}</ref>
===For succinate production=== Increasing the yield of succinate from mixed acid fermentation was first done by [[wikt:overexpression|overexpressing]] the enzyme [[Phosphoenolpyruvate carboxylase|PEP carboxylase]].<ref name="Millard1996">{{Cite journal | author=Millard, Cynthia Sanville | title= Enhanced production of succinic acid by overexpression of phosphoenolpyruvate carboxylase in Escherichia coli | journal=[[Applied and Environmental Microbiology]] | volume=62.5 | year=1996 | pages = 1808–1810|display-authors=etal}}</ref> This produced a succinate yield that was approximately 3 times greater than normal. Several experiments using a similar approach have followed.
Alternative approaches have altered the redox and [[Adenosine triphosphate|ATP]] balance to optimize the succinate yield.<ref name="Singh2011">{{Cite journal | author=Singh, Amarjeet | title=Manipulating redox and ATP balancing for improved production of succinate in E. coli | journal=[[Metabolic engineering]] | volume=13.1 | issue=1 | year=2011 | pages = 76–81 | doi=10.1016/j.ymben.2010.10.006| pmid=21040799 |display-authors=etal}}</ref>
==Related fermentation pathways== There are a number of other fermentation pathways that occur in microbes.<ref name=" Sharma2007" /> All these pathways begin by converting pyruvate, but their end products and the key enzymes they require are different. These pathways include: *[[Ethanol fermentation]] *[[Lactic acid fermentation]] *[[Propionic acid]] fermentation *[[Butanol]] fermentation *[[Butanediol fermentation]]
==External links== *[http://biocyc.org/META/NEW-IMAGE?type=PATHWAY&object=FERMENTATION-PWY Mixed acid fermentation] *[http://ecolistudentportal.org/article_fermentation EcoCyc Summary of Fermentation]

{{Refimprove|date=May 2012}} In [[physics]] and [[chemistry]], '''monatomic''' is a combination of the words "mono" and "atomic", and means "single [[atom]]". It is usually applied to [[gas]]es: a '''monatomic gas''' is one in which atoms are not bound to each other. All [[chemical elements]] will be monatomic in the gas phase at sufficiently high temperatures. The thermodynamic behavior of monatomic gas is extremely simple when compared to polyatomic gases because it is free of any rotational or vibrational energy.<ref>{{cite web|title=monatomic gas|url=http://www.britannica.com/science/monatomic-gas|publisher=Encyclopædia Britannica|accessdate=6 June 2016}}</ref>
==Noble gases== The only chemical elements that are stable single [[atom]] [[molecules]] at [[standard temperature and pressure]] (STP) are the [[noble gas]]es. These are [[helium]], [[neon]], [[argon]], [[krypton]], [[xenon]] and [[radon]]. Noble gases have a full outer valence shell making them rather non-reactive species.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Laszlo|first=Pierre|last2=Schrobilgen|first2=Gary J.|date=1988-04-01|title=Ein Pionier oder mehrere Pioniere? Die Entdeckung der Edelgas-Verbindungen|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/ange.19881000406/abstract|journal=Angewandte Chemie|language=en|volume=100|issue=4|pages=495–506|doi=10.1002/ange.19881000406|issn=1521-3757}}</ref> While these elements have been described historically as completely inert, chemical compounds have been synthesized with all but neon and helium.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Christe|first=Karl O.|date=2001-04-17|title=A Renaissance in Noble Gas Chemistry|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/1521-3773(20010417)40:83.0.CO;2-J/abstract|journal=Angewandte Chemie International Edition|language=en|volume=40|issue=8|pages=1419–1421|doi=10.1002/1521-3773(20010417)40:8%3C1419::aid-anie1419%3E3.0.co;2-j|issn=1521-3773}}</ref>
When grouped together with the [[homonuclear]] [[diatomic]] gases such as [[nitrogen]] (N<sub>2</sub>), the noble gases are called "elemental gases" or "molecular gases" to distinguish them from molecules that are also [[chemical compounds]].
==Other elements== [[Hydrogen atom|Monatomic hydrogen]] comprises [[abundance of the chemical elements|about 75% of the elemental mass of the universe]].<ref> {{cite web |last=Palmer|first=D. |title=Hydrogen in the Universe |url=http://imagine.gsfc.nasa.gov/docs/ask_astro/answers/971113i.html |publisher=[[NASA]] |date=13 September 1997 |accessdate=2008-02-05 }}</ref>
The motion of a monatomic gas is translation (electronic excitation is not important at room temperature). Thus in an [[adiabatic process]], monatomic gases have an idealised [[Heat capacity ratio|''γ''-factor]] (''C<sub>p</sub>''/''C<sub>v</sub>'') of 5/3, as opposed to 7/5 for ideal [[diatomic]] gases where rotation (but not vibration at room temperature) also contributes. Also, for ideal monatomic gases:<ref>[http://physics.bu.edu/~redner/211-sp06/class-thermodynamics/heatcap_volume.html Heat Capacity of an Ideal Gas]</ref><ref>[https://ccrma.stanford.edu/~jos/pasp/Heat_Capacity_Ideal_Gases.html Heat Capacity of Ideal Gases]</ref><ref>[http://depts.washington.edu/chemcrs/bulkdisk/chem152A_aut10/notes_Lecture_03_100610_revised.pdf Lecture 3: Thermodynamics of Ideal Gases & Calorimetry]{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, p. 2</ref> :the molar [[heat capacity]] at constant pressure (''C<sub>p</sub>'') is 5/2 ''R'' = 20.8 J K<sup>−1</sup> mol<sup>−1</sup> (4.97 [[Calorie|cal]] K<sup>−1</sup> mol<sup>−1</sup>); :the molar heat capacity at constant volume (''C<sub>v</sub>'') is 3/2 ''R'' = 12.5 J K<sup>−1</sup> mol<sup>−1</sup> (2.98 cal K<sup>−1</sup> mol<sup>−1</sup>); where ''R'' is the [[gas constant]].

{{cleanup|reason=fix lead, edit to be more specific to the EMP, edit for flow/style|date=July 2018}} The early modern age saw various economic changes as well as several significant diseases that have affected the mortality rates. Data collection during this time was not consistent or broadly recorded and there have been efforts to reconstruct plausible statistics.<ref name=":0">{{Cite journal|last=Laqueur|first=Thomas|title=The Work of the Dead: A Cultural History of Mortal Remains|journal=Journal of the History of Medicine and Allied Sciences|volume=72|issue=4|pages=504–506|doi=10.1093/jhmas/jrx024|issn=0022-5045|via=|year=2017}}</ref> Mortality rates vary on geographic location, social environment, and cultural values.<ref name=":1" /> There were also gender differences in the mortality rates, leading to an excess mortality rate in urban areas and in the female population.<ref name=":1">{{Citation|last=Derosas|first=Renzo|title=Life Under Pressure: Mortality And Living Standards In Europe And Asia, 1700-1900|date=|url=|work=Infant and Child Mortality|volume=|pages=327–398, 431–440|publisher=|isbn=|access-date=2018-07-24|last2=Breschi|first2=Marco|last3=Fornasin|first3=Alessio|last4=Manfredini|first4=Matteo|last5=Munno|first5=Cristina}}</ref> A main cause of death was [[stillbirth]], which could be attributed to, but not limited to, maternal infections, birth complications, and congenital anomalies.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.who.int/maternal_child_adolescent/epidemiology/stillbirth/en/|title=Stillbirths|website=World Health Organization|language=en-GB|access-date=2018-07-24}}</ref> Another contributing factor to the mortality rate was food insecurity and shortages as well as unemployment, both of which varied per region.<ref name=":3">{{Cite journal|last=Post|first=John D.|date=1990|title=The Mortality Crises of the Early 1770s and European Demographic Trends|journal=Journal of Interdisciplinary History|volume=21|issue=1|pages=29|doi=10.2307/204917|issn=0022-1953|jstor=204917}}</ref> A final factor was violence, which occurred mainly due to [[Structural violence|structural]] or systemic violence; however, violence since the 12th century has been steadily falling.<ref>{{Citation|last=Campbell|first=Roderick Campbell|title=Toward a Deep History of Violence and Civilization|url=http://ebookcentral.proquest.com/lib/ucsc/detail.action?docID=2084655|work=Violence and Civilization: Studies of Social Violence in History and Prehistory|volume=|pages=1–22|publisher=|isbn=9781782976202|access-date=2018-07-25|date=2013-12-31}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal|title=Steven Pinker on the myth of violence|last=Pinker|first=Steven|date=2007|website=PsycEXTRA Dataset|doi = 10.1037/e597002010-001}}</ref>
== Data Collection == Data from the early modern age was not accurately or consistently collected. However, there have been a number of studies and reconstructed statistics from this era, particularly on children and women. There has not been any empirical research published and the only information has been theoretical as there has been insufficient data and sources.<ref name=":0" /> It was also common for many statistics to go unreported; this is especially true regarding unmarried women.<ref name=":1" /> Models and theoretic equations need to take into account "social, economic, cultural, geographical, and even climatological variables" in order to accurately reflect the statistics of the time.<ref name=":1" />
== Gender differences == One study, the Eurasia Project, has shown that boys, especially those under one year, had a higher mortality rate during childhood than girls, but the mortality rate for men and women were about equal. It has also been shown that there is a higher male mortality than female mortality rate during the time of famine. Male mortality has also been linked to "economic modernization and urbanization ... especially for cardiovascular disease".<ref name=":1" />
Women faced increased mortality during childbirth as pregnancy and childbirth compromised the mother's immune system, with the most common causes of death being [[Postpartum infections|puerperal fever]], [[Pre-eclampsia|toxemia]], and [[Postpartum bleeding|hemorrhage]]. These dangers suggest an association to the excess female mortality, especially considering that women had to compete more for resources as they had no property rights and had a lower ranking in the household hierarchy. The average age of childbearing differed between Asia and Europe with an average difference of five years, which would affect cross-cultural data collection. Children born to mothers 35 years or older had a higher risk of mortality than children born to younger mothers. linking a mother's health and a child's survival.<ref name=":1" />
Female infants and children often had a higher mortality rate, especially in times of food insecurity, compared to male infants and children. However, a maternal presence worked as a protective factor for children. regardless of age or gender.<ref name=":1" />
== Economics == Food insecurity and shortages were common throughout this time period and were matched with the high food prices and high unemployment rate.<ref name=":3" /> This is shown through the differences in mortality rates between the lower and upper class, with poor infants being up to two times more likely to die than their wealthier counterparts.<ref name=":1" /> In 17th century Europe, it was common that at least one in five children from the same family would die before the age of one.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/21375348|title=Making sex : body and gender from the Greeks to Freud|last=Walter.|first=Laqueur, Thomas|date=1990|publisher=Harvard University Press|isbn=978-0674543492|location=Cambridge, Mass.|oclc=21375348}}</ref> Because of this high rate, it was common for there to be a large amount of children in one family so that there would be a higher rate of survival. Especially among poorer families, having multiple children was common in order to ensure there would be children to contribute to the family later on.<ref name=":1" />
During the early modern era, house calls were common. If the patient was female, the doctor, commonly an upper class male, would typically be summoned by a male family member who wound remain throughout the examination. The physician and male family member would then discuss the diagnosis and treatment plan without the female's input. This practice reinforced and perpetuated social hierarchies and patriarchal values.<ref name=":4">{{Cite book|last=Furth|first=Charlotte|date=1999-03-05|title=A Flourishing Yin: Gender in China's Medical History|journal=Isis|volume=93|issue=3|pages=479–480|doi=10.1086/374084|isbn=9780520208292|via=}}</ref>
== Death and diseases ==
Food shortages and insecurity were leading concerns in the 18th century, especially in Europe, and these were exacerbated by reduced harvests yields.<ref name=":3" /> Disease was another leading cause of death, with rats and fleas being the common carriers of disease, specifically plagues, during this era.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cdc.gov/plague/faq/index.html|title=FAQ {{!}} Plague {{!}} CDC|website=www.cdc.gov|language=en-us|access-date=2018-07-24}}</ref>
The [[Black Death]] was a plague that affected much of the world, originating in Asia and spreading to Europe through diseased fleas and rats. This epidemic has been reported to have been the cause of death for approximately "60% of the European population".<ref name=":2" />
During the end of the 19th century, there was a plague, known as the [[Third plague pandemic|Modern Plague]], that started in China and spread to different cities through ports, reportedly causing roughly ten million deaths.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.cdc.gov/plague/history/index.html|title=History {{!}} Plague {{!}} CDC|date=2018-05-31|website=www.cdc.gov|language=en-us|access-date=2018-07-24}}</ref> This plague affected Asia, the Americas, and Africa and lasted into the 20th century.<ref name=":2" /> There were also epidemics that occurred locally and did not spread to national levels, notably in 18th century England.<ref name=":3" /> These local epidemics included fevers, dysentery, smallpox, starvation, typhoid fever, under-nutrition, cholera, malaria.<ref name=":3" />
By the end of the era, [[disease]] and [[malnutrition]] were no longer the main leading causes of death.<ref name=":1" />

'''Nature Iraq''' (Arabic, طبيعة العراق) is [[Iraq|Iraq's]] first and only environmental conservation group.<ref>http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/0,1518,709866,00.html</ref> It is an [[Iraq]]i [[non-governmental organization]], accredited to the [[United Nations Environment Programme]] (UNEP) and affiliated to [[BirdLife International]]. They seek to protect, restore, and preserve Iraq’s natural environment and the rich cultural heritage that depends upon it. They conduct major work in [http://www.natureiraq.org/site/en/ni_projects_current sustainable development, biodiversity, and water resources]. Nature Iraq was founded in 2003 by [[Azzam Alwash]], an Iraqi refugee and engineer in the United States who returned to Iraq following the [[2003 invasion of Iraq]].
== Programs ==
'''The Key Biodiversity Areas (KBA) Program''' was initiated by Nature Iraq in partnership with the Iraqi Ministry of Environment and BirdLife International and other international advisory groups and included extensive field survey work from 2004 to 2010 to identify areas of the country that are globally important for their biological diversity. Eighty-two sites have been identified as KBAs in Iraq.<ref>http://www.natureiraq.org/draft-inventory-of-sites.html</ref>
'''Adobe House''' was built to demonstrate alternative, low-cost and sustainable building methods that could be applied to alternative housing in the marshland areas.
'''The Darwin Project''' conducts plants and birds’ surveys, creates biodiversity and land use maps, facilitate practical field training courses and an online course for developing professionals, conducts educational activities with school children, creates field guides and other educational resources for conservation managers.
'''Wetlands Restoration''' has been ongoing. Nature Iraq has successfully re-created some of Iraq's freshwater marshes in the central part of the country. <ref>{{cite web|website=http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2014/7/13/restoring-iraqs-lostmarshes.html}}</ref>
The '''Blue Horizons Laboratories''' is a private lab offering environmental lab services that was initially started by Nature Iraq. <ref>http://bluehltd.com/env/about.html</ref>
'''Waterkeepers Iraq''' was a program originally started by Nature Iraq but registered as an independent non-governmental organization in 2014. It advocates and works to protect the rivers, streams and waterways of Iraq and supports local communities in the sustainable use of these natural resources. Waterkeepers Iraq is affiliated with the international Waterkeeper Alliance. And is the first waterkeeper organization in the Middle East. <ref>http://www.waterkeepersiraq.org/</ref><ref>http://waterkeeper.org/</ref>
== See also == * [[Environmental issues in Iraq]]

{{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Nuclear Decommissioning Authority |type = |seal = Nuclear Decommissioning Authority logo.png |seal_width = 200px |formed = 1 April 2005 |preceding1 = Coal and Nuclear Liabilities Unit |preceding2 = |dissolved = |superseding = |jurisdiction = United Kingdom |headquarters = Herdus House, Westlakes Science & Technology Park, Moor Row, [[Cumbria]] |employees = 300 |budget = |minister1_name = [[Richard Harrington (politician)|Richard Harrington]] |minister1_pfo = [[Minister of State]] |chief1_name = David Peattie |chief1_position = Chief Executive |chief2_name = Tom Smith |chief2_position = Chairman |child1_agency = [[International Nuclear Services]] |child2_agency = [[Direct Rail Services]] |child3_agency = [[Radioactive Waste Management]] |child4_agency = [[Sellafield Ltd]] |website = {{url|http://www.gov.uk/nda}} |footnotes = |name=|logo=|chief3_name=|chief3_position=|chief4_name=|chief4_position=|chief5_name=|chief5_position=|chief6_name=|chief6_position=|chief7_name=|chief7_position=|chief8_name=|chief8_position=|chief9_name=|chief9_position=|parent_department=|agency_type=[[Non-departmental public body]]}} The '''Nuclear Decommissioning Authority''' ('''NDA''') is a [[non-departmental public body]] of the [[Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy]], formed by the [[Energy Act 2004]]. It evolved from the Coal and Nuclear Liabilities Unit of the [[Department of Trade and Industry (United Kingdom)|Department of Trade and Industry]]. It came into existence during late 2004, and took on its main functions on 1 April 2005. Its purpose is to deliver the [[Nuclear decommissioning|decommissioning]] and clean-up of the [[Nuclear power in the United Kingdom|UK’s civil nuclear]] legacy in a safe and cost-effective manner, and where possible to accelerate programmes of work that reduce hazard. The NDA does not directly manage the UK's nuclear sites. It oversees the work through contracts with specially designed companies known as Site Licence Companies. The NDA determines the overall strategy and priorities for managing decommissioning. Although the NDA itself only employs 300 staff, its annual budget is £3.2 billion. The vast majority of the NDA budget is spent through contracts with Site Licence Companies, who also sub contract to other companies which provide special services. The NDA aims to do this by introducing innovation and contractor expertise through a series of competitions similar to the model that has been used in the United States. In April 2017, the NDA lost a legal case in the [[UK Supreme Court|Supreme Court]] regarding the [[Public procurement|procurement]] of a sizeable contract for the decommissioning of 12 different Magnox nuclear facilities when EnergySolutions EU Ltd. (now called ATK Energy EU Ltd.) challenged a decision in connection with ATK’s unsuccessful bid.[https://www.supremecourt.uk/cases/docs/uksc-2016-0006-press-summary.pdf Press Summary: Nuclear Decommissioning Authority (Appellant) v EnergySolutions EU Ltd (now called ATK Energy EU Ltd) (Respondent) [2017] UKSC 34 on appeal from: [2015] EWCA Civ 1262], 11 April 2017 In February 2018 the UK parliament's [[Public Accounts Committee (United Kingdom)|Public Accounts Committee]] (PAC) concluded that the NDA had "dramatically under-estimated" costs and "completely failed" in the procurement and management of the [[Magnox Ltd]] contract, which was one of the highest value contracts let by the government. An independent inquiry into the deal was set up.{{cite news |url=http://www.world-nuclear-news.org/C-NDA-to-take-over-management-of-Magnox-sites-0307185.html |title=NDA to take over management of Magnox sites |publisher=World Nuclear News |date=3 July 2018 |accessdate=9 July 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201719/cmselect/cmpubacc/461/46102.htm |title=The Nuclear Decommissioning Authority's Magnox contract |publisher=UK Parliament |work=Public Accounts Committee |date=27 February 2018 |accessdate=9 July 2018}} ==Activities== === Objectives=== The main objectives of NDA are to: *eliminate site hazards and develop waste solutions; *ensure the highest standards in safety, security and environmental management; *build an effective world class industry; *gain full approval and support from stakeholders (employees, contractors, government, local communities and general public); and *make best use of assets and maximise value-for-money. ===Structure=== [[File:Aerial view Sellafield, Cumbria - geograph.org.uk - 50827.jpg|thumb|[[Sellafield]], NDA's largest site]] Responsibility for operating the sites has been restructured into five Site Licence Companies (SLCs). The management of the SLCs is contracted out to different Parent Body Organisations (PBOs), which are owned by private companies.[http://www.nda.gov.uk/news/slc-names.cfm NDA Confirms Names of New Site Licence Companies], Nuclear Decommissioning Authority (14 February 2007) *'''[[Sellafield Ltd]]''' was previously [[BNFL]]'s '''British Nuclear Group''' subsidiary. It comprises [[Sellafield]] nuclear chemical facility, [[Calder Hall]] and [[Windscale]]. It also previously managed the [[Capenhurst]] [[uranium]] enrichment plant, which is now owned by [[Urenco Group|Urenco]].{{cite news|url=http://www.world-nuclear-news.org/C-Urenco_takes_on_Capenhurst_site-3011125.html |title=Urenco takes on Capenhurst site |publisher=World Nuclear News |date=30 November 2012 |accessdate=2012-12-13}} Its PBO was formerly Nuclear Management Partners Ltd, a consortium of [[URS Corporation|URS]], [[Amec Foster Wheeler]] and [[Areva]]. However, Sellafield Ltd has been under the direct control of the NDA since April 2016. *'''[[Magnox Ltd]]''' previously two separate Site Licence Companies)[http://www.magnoxsites.co.uk/news/2011-01-11/magnox-limited Magnox Limited] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120402112105/http://www.magnoxsites.co.uk/news/2011-01-11/magnox-limited |date=2012-04-02 }}, manages ten [[Magnox]] nuclear power stations and the [[Harwell Laboratory|Harwell]] and [[Winfrith]] facilities. Magnox Sites (11 January 2011) It comprises [[Chapelcross nuclear power station|Chapelcross]], [[Hunterston A nuclear power station|Hunterston A]], [[Trawsfynydd nuclear power station|Trawsfynydd]], [[Wylfa nuclear power station|Wylfa]] and [[Oldbury nuclear power station|Oldbury]] (previously '''Magnox North Ltd''') and [[Berkeley nuclear power station|Berkeley]], [[Bradwell nuclear power station|Bradwell]], [[Dungeness nuclear power station|Dungeness A]], [[Hinkley Point A nuclear power station|Hinkley Point A]] and [[Sizewell nuclear power stations|Sizewell A]] (previously '''Magnox South Ltd'''). Its PBO is Cavendish Fluor Partnership Ltd, a consortium of [[Babcock International]] and [[Fluor Corporation|Fluor]]. *'''Dounreay Site Restoration Ltd''' comprises the [[Dounreay]] site. Its PBO is Cavendish Dounreay Partnership Ltd, a consortium of [[Babcock International]], [[CH2M HILL]] and [[URS Corporation|URS]]. *'''LLW Repository Ltd''' comprises the [[Low Level Waste Repository]] near [[Drigg]] in Cumbria. Its PBO is UK Nuclear Waste Management Ltd, a consortium of [[URS Corporation|URS]], [[Studsvik]], [[Areva]] and [[Serco]]. *'''Springfields Fuels Ltd''' comprises the [[Springfields]] nuclear fuel production facility near Preston, Lancashire. Its PBO is [[Westinghouse Electric Company]], a subsidiary of [[Toshiba]]. On its creation, the NDA also took over ownership of [[Direct Rail Services]], the rail [[freight operating company]] set up by [[BNFL]] in 1995 to transport nuclear materials. The NDA is also the owner of [[International Nuclear Services]], which operates services on behalf of the NDA for the management and transportation of nuclear fuels. The NDA is also the owner of Radioactive Waste Management Ltd (RWM), which is responsible for implementing a geological disposal facility in the UK and provide radioactive waste management solutions. In February 2017 a national archive for the UK civil nuclear industry, named Nucleus, was opened in [[Wick, Caithness]], Scotland.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-highlands-islands-38855127 |title=National archive for nuclear industry opens in Wick |work=BBC News |date=14 February 2017 |accessdate=16 February 2017}} ==Costs== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; margin-left:10px" align="right" border="1" |+ NDA increasing estimates of remaining cost of decommissioning and clean-up{{cite report |url=http://www.parliament.uk/documents/commons-committees/public-accounts/Progress-on-Sellafield-Site.pdf |title=Nuclear Decommissioning Authority - Progress on the Sellafield site: an update |publisher=National Audit Office |date=March 2015 |accessdate=16 March 2015}} |- ! rowspan="2" | Year of
estimate !! Sellafield !! Other NDA sites !! Total |- ! colspan="3" | (£ billions, discounted) |- |2009-10 || 25.2 || 19.9 || 45.1 |- |2010-11 || 32.7 || 16.5 || 49.2 |- |2011-12 || 37.2 || 15.6 || 52.9 |- |2012-13 || 42.0 || 16.9 || 58.9 |- |2013-14 || 47.9 || 17.0 || 64.9 |- |2015-16 || 117.4 || 43.3 || 160.7 |- |2017-18{{cite report |url=https://www.nao.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/The-Nuclear-Decommissioning-Authority-progress-with-reducing-risk-at-Sellafield.pdf |title=The Nuclear Decommissioning Authority: progress with reducing risk at Sellafield |isbn=9781786042019 |publisher=National Audit Office |date=20 June 2018 |accessdate=10 July 2018 |page=27 |quote=The discounted provision has more than tripled since 2015, increasing from £73 billion in 2015 to £234 billion, due to changes in HM Treasury’s discount rates.}} || n/a || n/a || 234 |} In 2005 the cost of decommissioning these sites was planned at £55.8 billion, with Sellafield requiring £31.5 billion.{{cite report |url=http://www.nda.gov.uk/documents/upload/Draft_Strategy_for_Consultation_2005.pdf |title=NDA Strategy - draft for consultation |page=66 |publisher=Nuclear Decommissioning Authority |year=2005 |accessdate=7 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091122155158/http://www.nda.gov.uk/documents/upload/Draft_Strategy_for_Consultation_2005.pdf |archivedate=22 November 2009 |df= }} However, in 2006 the NDA reported that the cost of cleaning up existing waste was higher than previously thought, and gave a new estimated decommissioning cost of about £72 billion over a 100-year period.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/4859980.stm |title=Nuclear clean-up 'to cost £70bn' |publisher=BBC News |date=30 March 2006 |accessdate=2010-05-22}} In 2008 estimated decommissioning costs increased to £73.6 billion, or after taking account of [[discount window|discount rates]], £44.1 billion.{{cite web|url=http://www.nda.gov.uk/news/arac-0708.cfm |title=Annual Report & Accounts 2007/08 |publisher=Nuclear Decommissioning Authority |date= |accessdate=2010-05-22}} A 2006 estimate foresaw £14bn of offsetting income from reprocessing fuel at [[Sellafield]]. In 2009 the NDA sold land near three existing reactor sites for expected new nuclear power stations, for over £200m.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/environment/article5992467.ece |title=Prices soar as bidders fight for nuclear sites |publisher=The Sunday Times |date=29 March 2009 |author=Danny Fortson and Dominic O’Connell |accessdate=2010-05-22}} In 2013, a critical [[Public Accounts Committee (United Kingdom)|Public Accounts Committee]] report stated that the private consortium managing Sellafield has failed to reduce costs and delays. Between 2005 and 2013 the annual costs of operating Sellafield increased from £900 million to about £1.6 billion. The estimated lifetime [[Annual effective discount rate|undiscounted]] cost of dealing with the Sellafield site increased to £67.5 billion.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-cumbria-21298117 |title=Sellafield clean-up cost reaches 67.5bn, says report |publisher=BBC |date=4 February 2013 |accessdate=19 February 2013}}{{cite news apologise after projected clean-up costs passed the £70 billion mark in late 2013.{{Cite news |last= Macalister |first= Terry |date= 4 December 2013 |title= Sellafield bosses forced to say sorry over £70bn-plus cleanup costs |url= https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2013/dec/04/sellafield-boss-sorry-over-cleanup-costs |publisher=[[The Guardian|theguardian.com]] |accessdate= 5 December 2013 }} In 2014, the undiscounted decommissioning cost estimate for Sellafield was increased to £79.1 billion,{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/energy/10921309/Britains-nuclear-clean-up-bill-soars-to-110bn.html|title=Britain's nuclear clean-up bill soars to |title=Nuclear Provision: the cost of cleaning up Britain's historic nuclear sites |publisher=NDA |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=26 February 2017}} The annual operating cost will be £2 billion in 2016.{{cite news |url=http://www.world-nuclear-news.org/C-UK-decommissioning-agency-lays-out-plans-to-2019-06011501.html |title=UK decommissioning agency lays out plans to 2019 |publisher=World Nuclear News |date=6 January 2016 |accessdate=26 February 2017}} ==National Nuclear Laboratory== In 2006, the then Secretary of State for Trade and Industry announced his support for a [[National Nuclear Laboratory]] (NNL) to be based on the British Technology Centre at Sellafield and Nexia Solutions.[http://www.nda.gov.uk/stakeholders/newsletter/nnl-announced-sos.cfm Alistair Darling announces the formation of the National Nuclear Laboratory], Nuclear Decommissioning Authority (30/06/06). The NDA, as the owner of Sellafield site and the funder of majority of research required across the nuclear estate, was involved establishing the NNL in 2009.
